articles.title: Ri Yong Ho Meets Chinese Public Security Delegation
articles.content:
Ri Yong Ho Meets Chinese Public Security Delegation
Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- Ri Yong Ho, chief of the General Staff of the Korean People's Army, met and had a talk with the Chinese public security delegation headed by Liu Jing, executive vice-minister of Public Security, on Thursday.

articles.title: Gift from Chinese Public Security Delegation
articles.content:
Gift from Chinese Public Security Delegation
 Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received gifts from the Chinese public security delegation and the councilor of the European Society for the Study of the Juche Idea staying in the DPRK.
					 The gifts were conveyed to Ri Yong Ho, chief of the General Staff of the Korean People's Army, by Liu Jing, executive vice-minister of Public Security of China who is leading the delegation, and to an official concerned by Lyne Sinyodyium, councilor of the society, on Thursday.

articles.title: S. Korea's Sycophancy towards US under Fire
articles.content:
S. Korea's Sycophancy towards US under Fire
 Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea gave the following answer to the question put by KCNA on Thursday as regards the south Korean puppet authorities' closer collusion and tie-up with the U.S. while tightening the sanctions against the DPRK:
					 The "team for sanctions against north Korea" made up of bosses of the U.S. State Department and Department of Treasury during its tour of south Korea some time ago pressurized the south Korean puppet authorities to join in the sanctions against Iran, while being closeted with them over sanctions against the DPRK.
					
					 The puppet group, disgustingly toeing the U.S. policy, formally decided to join in the sanctions against Iran and started their implementation. 
					
					 This is touching off bitter indignation among all Koreans from all walks of life including those in the north and the south and sparking international furor as it once again disclosed the true colors of the puppet group as pro-U.S. sycophants and traitors who unhesitatingly meet any demand of their master for the confrontation with fellow countrymen. 
					
					 The recent confab showed the disgraceful and poor plight of the south Korean puppet group as lackeys of the U.S. as it was one more intolerable collusion and nexus between the master and his servant. 
					
					 The puppet group is busying itself with the moves to escalate the confrontation with fellow countrymen and ignite a war as cat's paws of the U.S. only to come under fire and suffer disgrace at home and abroad. 
					
					 He who digs a pit for others falls into it. For its pursuance of the U.S. policy, the puppet group has been thrown into such a miserable position, censured by the public at home and abroad.
					
					 The "south Korea-U.S. alliance" is nothing but a tool for realizing the U.S. aggressive strategy for "world domination".
					
					 Great irony is that the group of traitors, lost to shame, is touting much that "never has there been such strong south Korea-U.S. alliance as at present" and "we feel reassured."
					
					 This group will have to pay a dear price for its despicable sycophancy towards the U.S.

articles.title: DPRK-China Cooperation Plans Signed
articles.content:
DPRK-China Cooperation Plans Signed
 Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- A 2010-2012 cooperation plan in the fields of standardization, weighing and quality management, a 2010-2012 cooperation plan in the field of inspection and quarantine and a 2010-2012 cooperation plan in the field of quality certification between the State Administration for Quality Management of the DPRK and the State General Administration of Quality Supervision, Inspection and Quarantine of China were signed in Beijing on Wednesday. 
					 Present at the signing ceremony from the DPRK side were members of the delegation of the State Administration for Quality Management of the DPRK led by Director Choe Kwang Rae and from the Chinese side Wang Yong, director general of the State General Administration of Quality Supervision, Inspection and Quarantine of China, and officials concerned. 
					
					 The cooperation plans were inked by Choe and Wang.

articles.title: Testimonies Made to Japanese Crimes against Humanity
articles.content:
Testimonies Made to Japanese Crimes against Humanity
 Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- A meeting for hearing testimonies made by victims of the crimes committed by the Japanese imperialists against humanity was held in Pyongyang Thursday on the occasion of the 65th anniversary of the defeat of the Japanese imperialists and the centenary of the fabrication of the "Korea-Japan Annexation Treaty."
					 Present there were officials of the Committee on Measures for Former Korean "Comfort Women" for Japanese Army and Drafting Victims, victims of crimes committed by the Japanese imperialists against humanity, bereaved families, working people and youth and students in the city, members of the home-visiting group of Joson University of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan, the secretary general of the Central Headquarters of the Koreans' Side of the Fact-Finding Group for the Probe into the Truth about the Forcible Drafting of Koreans and Japanese activists for demanding Japan's postwar compensation.
					
					 Also present there were media persons in Pyongyang, correspondents of China and Russia here and reporters of Japan's Kyodo News Service.
					
					 Hong Son Ok, chairwoman of the Committee on Measures for Former Korean "Comfort Women" for Japanese Army and Drafting Victims, in a report said that victims of the sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army and forcible drafting and A-bomb victims are appealing to the people to help them give vent to their grudge through generations, cursing Japan which does not feel any responsibility for its crimes. 
					
					 The meeting heard testimonies made by victims of the crimes committed by the Japanese imperialists against humanity.
					
					 Jon Ryong Bok, victim of the forcible drafting by the Japanese imperialists, testified to the fact that he was kidnapped and taken to Japan in his early years and forced to do slave labor.
					
					 The Japanese government has gone so impudent as to dodge its responsibility, without making any apology and reparation to the victims though 65 years have passed, he said, stressing that he would never forget the crimes Japan committed against the Korean people.
					
					 The participants watched a video showing victims of the sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army making testimonies.
					
					 The victims of the sexual slavery indicted the Japanese imperialist aggressors for forcibly taking away or kidnapping Korean women, wantonly violating their chastity and dignity, and urged the Japanese government to unconditionally make apology and reparation for the crime-woven past.
					
					 Ro Hyon Hwa, victim of the sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army, Kim Won Gyong, member of the bereaved family of forcible drafting by the Japanese imperialists, and Ri Kye Son, A-bomb victim, who spoke at the end of the video showing stressed that it is the duty and responsibility of the Japanese government to make apology and reparation for the pain Japan inflicted upon the Korean victims and their descendents.
					
					 Prof. Kenichi Asano at Doshisha University of Japan, activist for demanding Japan's postwar compensation, said in his speech that the Japanese government has refused to admit its crimes and make apology and reparation to the Korean people for the past years, stressing that it is an urgent duty of Japan to redeem its past from a legal and ethical point of view.
					
					 Read out at the meeting was a letter addressed to the Japanese government by victims and bereaved families who attended the meeting on behalf of all the victims and bereaved families in the DPRK.
					
					 The letter accused the Japanese government of having not only dodged apology and reparation to the victims for 65 years but shamelessly justified and whitewashed them.
					
					 All the victims, bereaved families and other people in the DPRK lodge a protest with the Japanese government against their act of having persistently dodged the settlement of such hideous crimes as drafting more than 8.4 million Koreans to battlefields of wars of aggression and sites of hard labor, killing more than one million and reducing 200,000 Korean women to sexual slaves for the Imperial Japanese Army, the letter said, adding that they strongly urge it once again to opt for making apology and reparation for the crime-woven past as early as possible.
					
					 If the Japanese government truly stands for the future of the country and is willing to be as a dignified member of the international community, it should meet the requirements of all the victims and other Koreans and honor its responsibility and obligation while the victims are alive, the letter stressed.

articles.title: DPRK-China Youth Joint Friendship Meeting Held
articles.content:
DPRK-China Youth Joint Friendship Meeting Held
 Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- The DPRK-China youth joint friendship meeting took place here on Thursday. 
					 Present there were officials of the Central Committee of the youth league, youth and students in Pyongyang and members of the Chinese youth friendship delegation. 
					
					 Speakers at the meeting referred to the fact that the DPRK-China friendship provided by President Kim Il Sung together with Chinese revolutionaries of the elder generation has grown stronger under the deep care of General Secretary Kim Jong Il and President Hu Jintao.
					
					 They called upon the young peoples of the two countries to contribute to steadily developing the DPRK-China friendship, the common wealth of the two countries. 
					
					 The meeting was followed by an art performance given by the Art Squad of the Central Committee of the youth league and young Chinese artistes. 
					
					 Members of the art squad put on the stage colorful numbers including chorus "Party Represents Care of the General", mixed chorus "Push Back the Frontiers of Latest Science and Technology", dance "Girls Digging out Shellfish", male solo of Chinese song "Song for One" and female solo of Chinese song "True Hero". 
					
					 Young Chinese artistes presented female solo "In the Hope-filled Field", chorus "Jasmine Flower" and chorus of  Korean song "Arirang" and others. 
					
					 The art performance was followed by a pleasant dancing party of young peoples of the two countries.

articles.title: Bloom-prolonging Agent Developed
articles.content:
Bloom-prolonging Agent Developed
 Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- The Kimilsungia and Kimjongilia Reaserch Centre of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea has recently developed a bloom-prolonging agent, called "Chonghwa", to be applied to Kimjongilia, a world-famous flowering plant.
					 After years of research into it, the center came to a conclusion that resistance to flower wilting can sharply be increased even in unfavorable conditions of temperature and humidity when water and ion are allowed to be absorbed into the plant rapidly and its cells' water-keeping capacity is raised.
					
					 The center has made the agent to be penetrated into petal tissues with a mixture of sugar, organic acids, microelements, physiological activators, vegetable interphase activators and antiseptics.
					
					 According to Ri Pyong Pha, head of the center, the agent makes it possible to keep Kimjongilia in large bloom for a long time and boost its resistant properties. With vegetable interphase activators contained, it also promotes the absorption of organic and inorganic elements into leaves and petal tissues and vivifies the flower. 
					
					 Applied at the ratio of a hundred parts of water to one of the agent, once a day or a few days when the plant comes into bloom, it lengthens the blooming period a week in summer and 20 days in winter.
					
					 It, which produces no adverse effect on the growth of the plant, has already been accepted by greenhouses throughout the country.

articles.title: Regime of Traitors Bound to Go Ruin
articles.content:
Regime of Traitors Bound to Go Ruin
 Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- It is the inevitability of history that the regime of traitors in south Korea is bound to go to ruin as it goes against the desire and wishes of the popular masses. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Thursday says this in a signed article.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 The reality today when the crisis of the south Korean conservative regime is getting ever-deeper goes to prove the inevitability of the destruction of the group of traitors. 
					
					 Total failures in its unpopular domestic and foreign policies have thrown the puppet group into an extremely serious ruling crisis. The "draft amendment to the plan for building Sejong City" which it has pushed forward defying the desire and demands of the people was thrown into the dustbin of history and the project for "improving the four big rivers", the most typical traitorous policy of the regime, has been rejected by different circles. Ceaseless infighting is going on inside the Grand National Party of south Korea over the blame for its domestic and foreign policy failures and power share. 
					
					 The situation has already turned unfavorable to the regime of traitors and its fate has been sealed.
					
					  It is as clear as a pikestaff that the south Korean people cannot escape such a miserable fate as being victims of a nuclear war to be provoked by foreign forces, much less realizing the desire for independence, democracy and reunification as long as the puppet group is allowed to stay in power. An all-out struggle of the south Korean people to eliminate this group is, therefore, inevitable. 
					
					 It is quite logical that there is no way out for the group of traitors as it has become a target of the people's struggle, forsaken by them. 
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak group is making desperate efforts to get rid of the abyss of ruin, but it will get the group nowhere.

articles.title: Fidel Castro Warns World of US Nuclear War Threat
articles.content:
Fidel Castro Warns World of US Nuclear War Threat
 Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- Leader of the Cuban revolution Fidel Castro, addressing a session of the National Assembly of People's Power of Cuba on August 7, warned the world of the U.S. nuclear war threat.
					 He said that if the U.S. attacks Iran and the DPRK, it will spark off armed conflicts in the Far East, the Near East and the whole Eurasian continent simultaneously.
					
					 In that case a nuclear war will break out worldwide, he said, stressing the need to urgently defuse such threat.

articles.title: Japanese Authorities' Policy of Discrimination under Fire
articles.content:
Japanese Authorities' Policy of Discrimination under Fire
 Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- Hong Ryong Su, vice-chairman of the Korean Youth Commercial Association in Japan, and other representatives of the association on August 6 met with officials concerned of the Ministry of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology to protest against the discriminatory policy of the Japanese authorities against the Korean schools in Japan.
					 The exclusion of the Korean schools only from the tuition-waiver program for senior high schools is a blatant discriminating action, they noted, demanding that the program be applied to the Korean schools, too, as is the case with other foreign schools in Japan. 
					
					 The Korean schools are the institutions which instill the soul of the Korean nation into Korean schoolchildren in Japan and the Japanese government should not trample down upon their future, they held.
					
					 On the same day, Pak Chang Gil, permanent adviser to the Tokyo Metropolitan Headquarters of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan, and others concerned of the Korean schools in Tokyo and Nishi Tokyo also visited the above-said ministry to demand the inclusion of the Korean schools in the tuition-waiver program. 
					
					 They handed a paper of more than 23,400 signatures to the ministry and read out a written request in the joint name of the Educational Society and the Patrons' Society for Tokyo Korean Senior High School and the Liaison Council of Mothers Society of Tokyo Korean School and written requests from the Patrons' Society in the area of Nishi Tokyo.

articles.title: Songun Politics of DPRK Highly Praised
articles.content:
Songun Politics of DPRK Highly Praised
 Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- A lecture took place in Mexico and film shows in South Africa and Thailand on August 6 on the occasion of the 50th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's start of the Songun revolutionary leadership.
					 The president of the Mexican National Coordinating Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea in a lecture explained in detail about the essence, validity and vitality of the Songun politics with the reality of the DPRK.
					
					 Saying that the Songun politics pursued by Kim Jong Il is the original political mode never known to the world, he stressed that its might is being strikingly demonstrated in the DPRK which has reliably defended socialism from the offensive of the imperialist allied forces to stifle it.
					
					 The secretary of the African National Congress Youth League of South Africa praised Kim Jong Il as the great guardian who firmly guarantees peace and security of not only the Korean Peninsula but the world with his Songun politics.
					
					 Participants of the film shows watched Korean films including "Reply of Korea."

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Songun Leadership Feats Lauded
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Songun Leadership Feats Lauded
 Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- Humberto Vargas Carbonel, general secretary of the People's Vanguard of Costa Rica, issued a statement on Aug. 5 on the occasion of the 50th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's start of Songun revolutionary leadership.
					 The statement said that Kim Jong Il's start of Songun leadership was an event of weighty significance in the history of the Workers' Party of Korea and the Korean people.
					
					 It went on to say:
					
					 Kim Jong Il turned the DPRK into a political and ideological power and definitely put it on the position of military power through his original Songun leadership.
					
					 Under his Songun leadership the Korean People's Army has been prepared as an invincible army fully equipped with the modern offensive and defensive means and the DPRK has secured even the powerful war deterrent capable of repelling any formidable enemy at one blow.
					
					  Noting that signal achievements are registered in the building of a thriving nation in the DPRK day by day after the torch of a new great revolutionary surge, kindled by Kim Jong Il, swept the whole country, the statement said that the DPRK will always display its  might as an invincible state under his Songun leadership.

articles.title: S. Korean Warmongers' War Moves Denounced
articles.content:
S. Korean Warmongers' War Moves Denounced
 Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- The Switzerland-Korea Committee and the Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea made public a joint statement in denunciation of the anti-DPRK war moves of the south Korean puppet warmongers on August 4.
					 The statement branded the naval firing conducted by the south Korean puppet warmongers in the West Sea of Korea as a blatant act of intrusion into the inviolable territorial waters of the DPRK.
					
					 Recalling that the Command of Forces of the Korean People's Army in the western sector of the front warned that it would counter the reckless naval firing projected by the Lee Myung Bak group with strong physical retaliation, the statement said:
					
					 As the DPRK had already clarified more than once, there is only the extension of the Demarcation Line in the West Sea of Korea fixed by the DPRK.
					
					 It is the unshakable and invariable will of the DPRK and the Korean people to return fire for fire.
					
					 Whoever intrudes into the territorial waters of the DPRK will face strong strikes.
					
					 The statement stressed that the above-said organizations denounce the moves of the south Korean warmongers to escalate the confrontation with the DPRK and extend full support to the righteous stand of the KPA.

articles.title: Story of Kim Jong Suk
articles.content:
Story of Kim Jong Suk
 Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- One day in February Juche 35 (1946) half a year after the liberation of the country, President Kim Il Sung had a discussion with some officials on the building of a new country in his residence till late at night.
					 After midnight a gun report rang out suddenly not far from the residence and the electric light went out.
					
					 The President in a calm tone told the officials that they did not need to be surprised at the shot as it seemed that some wicked persons were working mischievously. He then suggested taking a break before resuming the discussion and stepped toward the entrance.
					
					 When he reached the gate, he found anti-Japanese heroine Kim Jong Suk standing in his way with a mauser in her hand.
					
					 She dissuaded him from going out of the residence, saying that it was a demand of the guards. 
					
					 Her attitude was analogous to that taken by her to protect the President from danger during the anti-Japanese armed struggle.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il recibe presentes dedicados por extranjeros
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il recibe presentes dedicados por extranjeros
Pyongyang, 12 de agosto (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il recibio presentes que le dirigieran la delegacion de Seguridad Publica de China presidida por el viceministro ejecutivo de Seguridad Publica Liu Jing y el consejero de la Sociedad Europea para el Estudio de la Idea Juche, Lyne Sinyodyium, de visita en Corea.
					El dia 12, el huesped chino traslado tal regalo a Ri Yong Ho, jefe del Estado Mayor General del Ejercito Popular de Corea, y el segundo lo hizo a un funcionario coreano.

articles.title: Rubricados planes de cooperacion entre Corea y China
articles.content:
Rubricados planes de cooperacion entre Corea y China
Pyongyang, 12 de agosto (ATCC) -- Quedaron firmados el dia 11 en Beijing los planes de cooperacion para el periodo 2010-2012 entre la Direccion Estatal de Verificacion de la Calidad de Productos de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y el Buro General Estatal de Supervision, Control y Cuarentena de la Calidad de Productos de la Republica Popular China.
					Los planes comprenden la rama de estandarizacion, medicion y verificacion de la calidad de productos, la de supervision y cuarentena y la de certificacion de la calidad de productos.
					
					En la ceremonia de firmas participaron por la parte coreana los miembros de la delegacion de la Direccion Estatal de Verificacion de la Calidad de Productos encabezada por su director Choe Kwang Rae y por la china, el director general de la entidad homologa Wang Yong y otros funcionarios. 
					
					Choe Kwang Rae y Wang Yong suscribieron los documentos.

articles.title: Filmados nuevos dibujos animados
articles.content:
Filmados nuevos dibujos animados
Pyongyang, 12 de agosto (ATCC) -- Recientemente, los Estudios de Filmes para Ninos 26 de Abril de Corea produjeron nuevos dibujos animados.
					 "La hora de siesta", parte 7 de la "Estrella roja", destaca la necesidad de observar bien el horario del circulo infantil a traves de la actuacion de Yong Nam que gana una estrella roja (condecoracion a los ninos de buena conducta) cogiendo el habito de dormir la siesta con la ayuda de sus companeros.
					
					 El "Suceso en la aldea Saemgol" da conocimientos de referencia sobre el terremoto mostrando los sintomas que se producen en los alrededores cuando llega un temblor.
					
					  "Kamjang perdido" ensena la moraleja de que se debe repasar las clases faltadas, contando la historia de la hormiga Kamjang que sufre desgracias por no haber estudiado bien.
					
					  Entre los nuevos munes que contribuyen a la educacion de los ninos hay tambien "Escandalo producido por las balanzas hermanas" y "Guardia del almacen de Paramgol".
					
					Estos cortometrajes dan la leccion de que hay que poseer ricos conocimientos para tener buenos resultados.

articles.title: Es inevitable la ruina del "poder" traidor, destaca Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Es inevitable la ruina del "poder" traidor, destaca Rodong Sinmun
Pyongyang, 12 de agosto (ATCC) -- En un articulo individual difundido hoy, el diario Rodong Sinmun subrayo que es inevitable la ruina del "poder" traidor del Sur de Corea que se opone a la aspiracion y la demanda de las masas populares.
					 Esta verdad de la historia la comprueba la cada dia mas grave crisis que sufre el "poder" conservador surcoreano, senala el articulista y continua:
					
					 Ahora, debido al fracaso total de sus antipopulares politicas interior y exterior, la banda de titeres surcoreanos cayo en la crisis de gobernacion sin salida.
					
					  El "proyecto de enmienda de conformacion de la ciudad de Sejong", que impulsaba la banda de Lee Myung Bak en contra de la aspiracion y la demanda de la opinion publica, fue echado al basurero de la historia. Y "el arreglo de cuatro rios", politica traidora mas representativa, tropieza con el rechazo rotundo de todos los circulos.
					
					  En el seno del "Gran Partido Nacional" no cesan las pugnas por el poder y por imputar la responsabilidad del fracaso de las politicas exterior e interior.
					
					  Asi que ya fue decidido el destino del "poder" traidor.
					
					  Si deja intacta a la banda de traidores, la poblacion surcoreana no podra realizar su deseo de la independencia, la democracia y la reunificacion ni evitar el destino tragico de la victima de la guerra nuclear que desatarian las fuerzas foraneas.
					
					  Por lo tanto, es inevitable que los habitantes surcoreanos se levanten en la lucha pannacional por sepultar a esa camarilla.
					
					  No hay salvacion para la horda de vendepatrias que dio espaldas a las masas populares y se hizo el blanco de repudio de la opinion publica.
					
					  Sin embargo, la banda de Lee Myung Bak se mueve desesperadamente para liberarse de la crisis de destruccion.
